revised_title: Electron Emission Under Chemical Action: Advances in Pressure Measurement and Alloy Flow
tldr: This article describes the author's research on the emission of electrons under chemical action, focusing on the development of a new method for measuring pressure and controlling the flow of a liquid alloy. The authors designed an improved vacuum system that allowed them to measure pressures as low as 10^-5 mmHg and maintain a constant pressure during experiments. This research contributed to a better understanding of electron emission and the potential applications in technology and science.
